channel.title: Fix run.bat from loading JDK7
channel.description:
Help please? My client is loading jre7 and i want to change it because alot of players dont have JDK7 and just don't even try to download it.
@echo off Title LeanPkz V1 cd ./ "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 exit
I've tried changing jre7 to jre6 I've tried changing program files to program files (x86) Please helpppppppp?

item.title: Fix run.bat from loading JDK7
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

Go to:

Control Panel;
Java;
“Java” tab;
View;

and see which Java versions it picks up. If it picks up both your 6 and 7 versions, disable version 7 and enable version 6. This helped me out a lot with some runtime errors I was receiving, even though I uninstalled version 7.

Also, if zyle’s post doesn’t help, navigate to C:/Program Files/Java to see which JDK’s are installed. For example, if you have jdk1.6.0_07 installed you can run your client by using the following:

@echo off
"C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_07/bin/java" client 1 live live highmem members english game0
pause

Change the parameters to suit your client of course. Make sure you’ve set your environment variables too and they correlate with the correct JDK version you are trying to use.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:

[quote=“forever-rune, post:1, topic:442501”]Help please?
My client is loading jre7 and i want to change it because alot of players dont have JDK7 and just don’t even try to download it.

[quote]@echo off
Title LeanPkz V1
cd ./
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
exit[/quote]
I’ve tried changing jre7 to jre6
I’ve tried changing program files to program files (x86)
Please helpppppppp?[/quote]

java -Xmx500M Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
